dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: the Dow was down 150 points Wednesday, right? And the Nasdaq dropped almost a full percent?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: the Dow was down one hundred fifty points Wednesday, right? And the Nasdaq dropped almost a full percent?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 1.6%, around 450 points, on Wednesday, while the S&P 500 rose 1.8% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite gained 1.9%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and get this—Tesla, which just had its best day *ever* on Tuesday, fell over 5% the very next day. Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and get this-Tesla, which just had its best day ever on Tuesday, fell over five percent the very next day. Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas stock, which had its worst day ever on Tuesdayfalling 21% after being snubbed from the S&P 500 index, rose over 5% on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right?! And Apple, after gaining 14% in three sessions, also dropped more than 3%. It's like whiplash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right?! And Apple, after gaining fourteen percent in three sessions, also dropped more than three percent. It's like whiplash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of Apple, which fell 14% in the previous three sessions, also rebounded on Wednesday, gaining over 3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But, uh, not everything was down—Lululemon and Slack both shot up, like 7% and 14% even with bad earnings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But, uh, not everything was down-Lululemon and Slack both shot up, like seven percent and fourteen percent even with bad earnings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite both companies reporting better-than-expected corporate earnings, shares of athletic retailer Lululemon and workplace messaging platform Slack fell more than 7% and 14%, respectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's so counterintuitive. And then there's the AstraZeneca-Oxford vaccine news—fast-tracked because a patient recovered super quickly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's so counterintuitive. And then there's the AstraZeneca-Oxford vaccine news-fast-tracked because a patient recovered super quickly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Investors also shrugged off a setback with AstraZeneca and Oxfords late-stage coronavirus vaccine, which has now been put on hold due to a patient in the U.K. coming down with a mysterious illness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge said this dip is just… overbought conditions, but he thinks it's actually a chance to buy, not sell.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge said this dip is just... overbought conditions, but he thinks it's actually a chance to buy, not sell.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Wednesdays rally is simply a bounce from oversold conditions but investors shouldnt anticipate a V-shaped move right back to the highs, says Vital Knowledge founder Adam Crisafulli. If anything, sentiment around tech isnt conducive to forming a sustainable bottom with most people asking when (not if) the group should be bought as a result, bounces right now should be sold, not chased.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Chase the dips," he said, right? Like, sentiment's shifting—people aren't asking *when* to sell tech anymore, but *if* they should at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Chase the dips, he said, right? Like, sentiment's shifting-people aren't asking when to sell tech anymore, but if they should at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If anything, sentiment around tech isnt conducive to forming a sustainable bottom with most people asking when (not if) the group should be bought as a result, bounces right now should be sold, not chased.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And you know what's wild? Elon Musk officially regained his billionaire status thanks to that 472% stock surge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And you know what's wild? Elon Musk officially regained his billionaire status thanks to that four hundred seventy two percent stock surge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Of China Regains Billionaire Status With 472% Stock Surge

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Insane week. So much volatility, but maybe it's setting up for another run?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Insane week. So much volatility, but maybe it's setting up for another run?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Could be. I mean, the Nasdaq did jump 10% in just three days before this pullback. Feels like we're in for a W-shaped recovery, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Could be. I mean, the Nasdaq did jump ten percent in just three days before this pullback. Feels like we're in for a W-shaped recovery, honestly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following the sharp losses, the Nasdaq officially entered correction territory, falling 10% in just three days of trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Alright, let's take a quick break.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Alright, let's take a quick break.
